item.title: Report X-2025070797
item.description:
Report X-2025070797

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DECLARED GROUND HAZMAT SHIPMENT. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS OF ZEP CONCENTRATED LIME RUST STAIN REMOVER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE. THE CAPS ON THREE OF THE FOUR PLASTIC JUGS WHERE LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ACID TO LEAK FORM EACH BOTTLE. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report X-2025061711
item.description:
Report X-2025061711

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Jeremy Dewey contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Jeremy stated they were unloading tailer 570873 when they noticed a pallet containing boxes of UN1993, Flammable liquids, n.o.s. (Contains Petroleum Distillates Isopropanol), 3, PG II was leaking. Jeremy stated he bel ieves the freight shifted during transit and one box was damaged and caused a small puncture on (1) 1-gallon Jerrican resulting in a 2-quart spillage onto the box, pallet, and trailer floor. Jeremy stated no storm drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Rosa Gutierrez for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025070875
item.description:
Report X-2025070875

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-20
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE GROUND PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO OUTER BOX DESCRIPTION STATING TNT POP-ITS, NOTED AS TRIGGER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED VARIOUS NOVELTY FIREWORK CONTENTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS ARE 1Z35E5950390175883 AND 1Z35E5950394980291. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 35E595, TNT FIREWORKS-WAREHOUSE, 4511 HELTON DR, FLORENCE AL 35630-6239.

item.title: Report E-2025060442
item.description:
Report E-2025060442

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-28
  • City: OWATONNA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 08:49 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XOW) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 1 gallon of Chemlife 24 Coating (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri will be placed into a 55-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry.

item.title: Report E-2025060510

Report E-2025060510

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-25
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:58 AM ET, Jose Ortega with Circle K contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred at a fleet site owned by Circle K, located at 1845 S. Robert St. in Saint Paul, MN. The spill consists of approximately 5 gallons of gasoline fuel, which released from the driver's vehicle as he overfilled his tank. The spill has impacted concrete. Contractor used granular absorbents to clean up spill and containerized absorbents into one 55-gallon drum and transported drum offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060357
item.description:
Report E-2025060357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: BURNSVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:54 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at a customer location in Chaska, MN. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Vanilla Extract released from one 5-gallon pail due to being punctured by the customer while unloading the trailer. The release impacted trailer #4632581. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of UN1197 Vanilla Extract product released to a 40x6 area of the trailer floor and the asphalt lot below due to forklift puncture. The contractors used absorbents for cleanup and overpacked the waste and damaged pail and restacked the pallet for shipping. There were (2) poly drums, (1) 5-gallon and (1) 30-gallon. They used a degreaser to help bring up as much product as possible. The waste was taken off site and staged at vendors office for disposal.
